titleStmt.title: Temple Haynes to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6737

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency
Thomas. E. Bramlette, Governor of Kentucky.

Your Petitioners Temple Haynes and David T. Clark, would respectfully represent, that at the July Term 1865, of the Pulaski Circuit Court, a Judgment was rendered against them for $100, for failing to appear at said Court to answer a charge of the breach of the peace -- Your Petitioner Clark being security for Temple Haynes on his bond -- They state, that they thought the whole matter was fully settled up between them and one Tunstal Q Hamilton who sued out the warrent against Haynes -- That Hamilton had consented & agreed to not prosecute the matter further, being satisfied that the warrant was wrongfully sued out -- For this reason they did not appear at said court --
They further state, that Haynes was arrested & delivered to Col Eve, then Commanding at Point Burnside in this County, who to whose presence the whole difficulty was amicably settled --
Your Petitioners ask that the fine against them be released, as it is a hardship to have it to pay under all the circumstances --
We concur in the statements of the above & foregoing petition, and ask your Excelency to remit the fine

W. McKee. Fox
W Woodcock
Rob Gibson
Lewis Patteson
W. A. Collier
S. F. Tomlinson
H. S. Porch
